channel.title: Float-based Responsive Layout :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Now that we have seen the concept of responsive breakpoints, let’s put them to use creating a layout for our web page. Currently we have three <div> elements, each with a header and placeholder text. We’d like to arrange these into a row of three columns if the screen is large enough, and collapse them into a single column on smaller screens, such as a mobile phone. We’re going to explore several strategies for accomplishing this.
